You know about earthquakes, but what about moonquakes and marsquakes? We asked a NASA scientist about what otherworldly quakes can tell us: https://go.nasa.gov/3N68hP1

Oh, those summer nights! It's the #SummerSolstice, the longest day in the Northern Hemisphere—and the shortest in the Southern Hemisphere where winter starts.

Glance up tonight for a planetary cameo, with Mars and Venus just beside the Moon: https://go.nasa.gov/3CDqMaj

LIVE: Watch the ribbon-cutting for our new Earth Information Center at NASA Headquarters in Washington. The new tool will provide data to the public and decision makers to help adapt and respond to our changing planet: https://go.nasa.gov/eic
The Sun emitted a strong solar flare on June 20, 2023, peaking at 1:09 ET. NASA’s Solar Dynamics Observatory captured an image of the event, which was classified as X1.0. https://go.nasa.gov/3qSaNT7

Astronauts-eye view 

Take a look through the helmet cams of 
@Astro_Woody
 and Steve Bowen as they prepare to install a roll-out solar array during today's spacewalk.

Suits are set to battery power and today's spacewalk is underway!

This is Hoburg's second spacewalk and Bowen's 10th—tying a record for most spacewalks made by a U.S. astronaut.

Why is Venus so hot?

The planet’s thick CO2-filled atmosphere is great at trapping heat. This creates a runaway greenhouse effect that makes Venus roughly 700°F (389°C) hotter than it would be otherwise. 
@NASAJPL
's Dr. Amy Hofmann gives us the details: https://go.nasa.gov/42FxR4v

Welcome to the team!

You're looking at 45,000+ galaxies.

This image was taken as part of the JWST Advanced Deep Extragalactic Survey (JADES) — a massive science program that’s revolutionizing what we know about galaxies in the early universe: https://go.nasa.gov/3CdLq0s

Here are the highlights
Over 7,000 pounds of new experiments, new solar arrays, and other cargo has arrived at the station after the @SpaceX Dragon cargo craft docked to the Harmony module at 5:54am ET today.

#MissionToPsyche is on track for launch in October 2023!

An independent review board found JPL’s response to address factors contributing to the mission’s 2022 launch delay has been "world class."

LIVE: Tune in as we review next steps for the Psyche mission, set to launch no earlier than Oct. 2023. The spacecraft will study a metal-rich asteroid of the same name that may be the partial core of a building block of rocky planets in our solar system.
Dragon flies! @SpaceX's #CRS28 cargo launch lifted off from @NASAKennedy at 11:47am ET (1547 UTC). Learn more about the @ISS_Research it's sending to space: http://go.nasa.gov/43dcbOt

LIVE: We're sending science—and a new set of unrolling solar arrays—to the @Space_Station!

@SpaceX's uncrewed #CRS28 mission is scheduled to launch at 11:47am ET (1547 UTC), weather permitting. Watch with us.
